page.title: 01Gazetteer.
page.content: Burley is a small village of almost two thousand people situated in the heart of the New Forest.The village is famous for its open streets and it is a tourist centre.The New Forest surrounds the village and the ponies and the cattle can be seen even in the centre of the village.Its'history goes back over two thousand years with places of interest being the Old Mill area, the Church and Chapel, Castle Hill, the Old Railway, the Village School and the Queen's Head Public House as well as many interesting old cottages. The War Memorial in the centre of Burley is at the crossroads below the historic Bread Stone. The oldest house is believed to be in Burley Street, which is of {cruck construction. The Manor House was rebuilt after a fire.
